p: Arthropod-borne viruses (arboviruses) such as Zika virus (ZIKV), dengue virus (DENV) and chikungunya virus (CHIKV) have become an increasingly important global health threat. DENV and ZIKV are arboviruses belonging to the Flavivirus genus of the Flaviviridae family, and are both transmitted by the Aedes species mosquito vectors [ 5, 6]. CHIKV is an arbovirus belonging to the alphavirus genus of the Togaviridae family [ 6]. Some arboviruses have been temporally associated with the occurrence of GBS [ 5].
